channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Confederacy Goes on Trial, Along With Schools Named Jackson and Lee
item.description: In an unusual trial, the N.A.A.C.P. has sought to show a school board’s “racist intent” by proving that the names of Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jacks...

item.title: Trump complains Epstein files are a distraction as flight logs reveal deeper ties and ‘unfounded and false’ claims emerge
item.description: The biggest Epstein files information dump yet leaves questions unanswered.

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: Supreme Court Refuses to Allow National Guard Deployment in Chicago
Americans enjoy one refuge from inflation: The cheapest gas prices in years
item.description: Gas below $3 is a welcome relief to many Americans.

item.title: ‘This Is Something That Traditional Economics Isn’t Prepared to Deal With’
item.description: Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, the hosts of the economics podcast “Odd Lots,” walk through how Trump’s tariffs, A.I. and the vibecession are making...

item.title: ‘Cruel, unnecessary, and irresponsible’: Advocacy group slams Trump’s plan to garnish wages of student loan borrowers in default
item.description: Student loan borrowers see the end of leniency during Biden's term.

item.title: Oklahoma Instructor Mel Curth Who Failed Student Samantha Fulnecky’s Gender Essay Is Fired
item.description: The instructor, a graduate student at the University of Oklahoma, gave a zero to a student who wrote an essay arguing in favor of traditional gender d...

item.title: Republican lawmaker and notable Trump critic Ben Sasse announces stage 4 cancer: ‘Now marching to the beat of a faster drummer’
item.description: “I’m not going down without a fight," said the Ivy League-educated father of three.

item.title: Ben Sasse, Former Nebraska Senator, Shares Terminal Pancreatic Cancer Diagnosis
item.description: Mr. Sasse, a former senator from Nebraska, announced that he had received a diagnosis last week for Stage 4 pancreatic cancer.

item.title: JPMorgan to allow crypto trading for institutional clients in latest embrace of the sector
item.description: CEO Jamie Dimon appears to have reversed course from once equating Bitcoin with a “pet rock.”

item.title: Yemen’s Warring Sides Agree to Largest Prisoner Swap in a Decade of Fighting
item.description: The Houthi rebels and the internationally recognized government plan to exchange about 2,900 detainees, a rare humanitarian win at a time of deepening...

item.title: Ukraine Withdraws From Eastern Town, Complicating Negotiating Stance
item.description: The town of Siversk had served as a stronghold in the portion of eastern Donetsk still under Ukrainian control. Moscow wants Kyiv to surrender the tow...

item.title: Greta Thunberg Arrested at U.K. Protest Supporting Palestine Action Prisoners
item.description: The Swedish activist Greta Thunberg was arrested after holding a sign that the police said showed support for the group, which Britain banned this yea...

item.title: Zelensky Calls Peace Plan ‘Quite Solid,’ Russia Then Launches Missiles
item.description: Tuesday morning, hours after President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the latest American-backed proposals for a peace deal between Kyiv and ...

item.title: France Fails to Adopt a Budget by Year’s End. Again.
item.description: French lawmakers passed a special law on Tuesday to avoid a shutdown until a budget is adopted. Negotiations will resume in January.
